title: How to Turn Used Tires Into Storage Bins

steps.headline: Clean them thoroughly with bleach and scrub all dirt away.
Spray them first with a white coating.
steps.description: Since all tires are black, you need to prime it with white or gray before you can apply the color you desire.

steps.headline: Grab your spray paint cans and paint the tires.
steps.description: Have fun using any color you like!

steps.headline: Grab a jigsaw and cut a circular cover for your storage.
steps.description:
You'll place this on top of your uppermost tire. Smooth the cover with fine grit sandpaper. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/01\/Turn-Used-Tires-Into-Storage-Bins-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Turn-Used-Tires-Into-Storage-Bins-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/0\/01\/Turn-Used-Tires-Into-Storage-Bins-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/aid4252530-v4-728px-Turn-Used-Tires-Into-Storage-Bins-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Paint the cover and leave it to dry.
Drill two holes where you can place a handle for the cover.
Insert a rope into the holes and tie a knot on each end.
Put the tires on top of each other.
steps.description: You can stack up 2 to 3 tires depending on your needs. Use a strong adhesive to bind the tires together

steps.headline: Store anything you like in your new storage bin made of tires!

text:
Gather your used tires. Clean them thoroughly with bleach and scrub all dirt away. Spray them first with a white coating. Since all tires are black, you need to prime it with white or gray before you can apply the color you desire. Grab your spray paint cans and paint the tires. Have fun using any color you like! Grab a jigsaw and cut a circular cover for your storage. You'll place this on top of your uppermost tire. Smooth the cover with fine grit sandpaper. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/01\/Turn-Used-Tires-Into-Storage-Bins-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Turn-Used-Tires-Into-Storage-Bins-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/0\/01\/Turn-Used-Tires-Into-Storage-Bins-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/aid4252530-v4-728px-Turn-Used-Tires-Into-Storage-Bins-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Paint the cover and leave it to dry. Drill two holes where you can place a handle for the cover. Insert a rope into the holes and tie a knot on each end. Put the tires on top of each other. You can stack up 2 to 3 tires depending on your needs. Use a strong adhesive to bind the tires together Store anything you like in your new storage bin made of tires!
